{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3455568,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-06T02:00:48.664Z","cooked":"

Our team wants to use the WCP ThroughBore encoder. Correct me if I’m wrong, but I think it’s just CanCoder + plastic shell, right?
We have some spare CanCoders, so we don’t want them to come with more CanCoders inside. We have a 3d printer, can we 3d print the plastic shell and put existing CanCoders inside?

There is a cheap redux robotics kit that allows you to upgrade a cancoder

Redux Robotics

Through Bore Upgrade

Price: USD 12.5

It is also even better than the WCP throughbore due to mounting holes

Just a note, we have not validated or tested this with the CTR-Electronics Cancoder. This case is meant for the Redux Robotics Helium Canandmag, which is distinct formfactor wise.

A small list of the reasons why it won’t work are enumerated here. As a note, the design of the throughbore changed from that post, which makes it further more difficult to use with that product.

Redux Robotics 2023-2024 General Forum
Short answer: No, we recommend using the product with the Helium Canandmag. Longer answer: Yes, but it will require some modifications, some significant. Full answer: As far as we can tell, CTR-Electronics uses 1.4mm thick PCBs, whereas we use 1.6mm thick PCBs. This means that some of the dimensions will not line up, most crucially the spacer between the throughbore cover and the case. In addition, CTR-Electronics does not have the two 4-40 holes that we use for locating the top cover and mou…

To be clear, the new WCP ThroughBore does not use the existing CTR CANcoder board inside. It is using CTR CANcoder technology, but the PCB inside is new and unique to this device.

Want to make sure it is clear that the WCP ThroughBore does have a mount hole. We intentionally chose to only have one mount hole on the device, as using more than one can actually overconstrain the device.

Putting a shaft through the encoder already constraints it’s position, the mount hole then constraints the rotation of the case about the shaft. This fully constraints the device; an additional hole can potentially overconstrain things, leading to unwanted loads.

As a bonus the extra mount hole would also make the device larger.

We were 3D printing through bore housings for cancorders back in 2018, long before you could buy them COTS. The files will still work if you want them:
https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4055689
https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2805854
